intro: Calcitrapa subspinosa, commonly known as the spiny calcitrapa, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in rocky or dry soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Its scientific name reflects its calcareous habitat and spiny characteristics. Calcitrapa subspinosa is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
